result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return on warrant on November 8, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz requests a separate $2,500 bench warrant along with bond forfeiture proceedings in each matter. Attorney Restemayer has no objection. So Ordered.

10:23 AM Defendant Lance Phillip Naegele appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Lance Phillip Naegele.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions Attorney Restemayer gives statements in regards to the defendant's non-appearance at the Preliminary hearings. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant and re-instate bond. So ordered. Attorney Restemayer states Preliminary hearing has already been rescheduled and put back on the courts calendar.
Return on warrant on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
1 Certified copy returned from PRSO
1 warrant 3 cases: 22CF49, 22CF52, 22CF54

10:46 AM DA calls cases: 22CF49, 22CF52, and 22CF54 and states appearances. Defendant Lance Phillip Naegele not in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer appeared by video for Lance Phillip Naegele.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history of the cases and notices sent, no notices have been sent back undeliverable. Attorney Restemayer gives statements and comments in regards to non-appearance and requests this matter be adjourned and rescheduled due to unstable living situations of the defendant. DA Kelz moves for a bench warrant in the amount of $3,000. Court makes comments in regards to the history of addresses given. Court GRANTS the State's request for a bench warrant. Comments by parties.

10:32 AM DA Kelz calls cases: 22CF49, 22CF52, 22CF54. Defendant Lance Phillip Naegele appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaints in each matter acknowledged, reading waived. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived in each matter. Bond already set in each matter and is to continue. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for all matters.

2:18 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 04/19/22 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond set as requested.
